educations.schoolName: American University Washington College of Law
American University School of International Service

headline: J.D./M.A. Candidate at American University Washington College of Law and School of International Service
summary:
I am a third-year law student at American University Washington College of Law and a second-year graduate student at the School of International Service. 

Personal mission statement: to pursue balanced justice for crime victims and society at large through equally zealous and ethical advocacy as a dedicated representative of the state.

positions.description:
Civil Division, Office of Foreign Litigation and Office of International Judicial Assistance (Security Clearance: Public Trust)

Office of Foreign Litigation
â¢ Updated attorneys with analysis of Foreign Sovereign Immunities Act litigation strategy used by the United States and foreign governments against private parties in federal courts.
â¢ Liaison with State Department Advisory Committee on Private International Law Working Group VI for evaluating adoption of United Nations Commission on International Trade Law model laws.

Office of International Judicial Assistance
â¢ Responded to foreign courtsâ requests for evidence and service in the United States for civil and commercial litigation abroad pursuant to The Hague Evidence Convention (HEC).
â¢ Drafted advisory memoranda on consequences of unauthorized practice of law in blocking statute
jurisdictions and how privacy statutes control foreign courtsâ requests for confidential records.
â¢ Posted guidelines for foreign courts on third-party requests for tax information with step-by-step explanation of how to circumvent the HEC and coordinate directly with IRS for expedient results.

positions.title: Desk Clerk and Admissions Ambassador, Office of JD Admissions

positions.description:
â¢	Updated and maintained large database of client files based on an assortment of immigration proceedings and applications taking place both domestically and abroad 
â¢	Conducted regular correspondence and information sharing with American embassies and the National Visa Center to ensure timely and accurate processing of immigration applications and process
â¢	Drafted applications and appeals for clients seeking naturalization, permanent residency, family reunification petitions, and government benefits in accord with their immigration status as a refugee or asylee
â¢	Coordinated with other IRC offices when clients relocated and required the transfer of sensitive documents and personal information files for services and benefits
